summary: Eugenio Rolando Martinez Careaga, also known as Eugenio Martinez and Eugenio, is mentioned in documents spanning from 1961 to 1977 related to CIA activities, Cuban operations, and investigations into possible Cuban involvement in the JFK assassination. He was involved in the Watergate break-in and was part of a task force investigation into possible Cuban complicity in the John F. Kennedy assassination. The documents suggest Martinez had associations with the CIA and was connected to individuals involved in anti-Castro activities. He was potentially linked to the Watergate scandal through associations with figures like Bernard Barker and Frank Sturgis, suggesting his involvement in covert operations and intelligence gathering related to Cuba and anti-Castro efforts.
significance: Medium - Eugenio Rolando Martinez Careaga appears in a significant number of documents (11) and is connected to key events and organizations like the Watergate scandal and CIA activities related to Cuba. His potential involvement in anti-Castro activities and possible links to the JFK assassination investigation suggest a notable, though not necessarily central, role within the context of these historical events.
